p: Spraying SHEO obtained from Iranian plants (major components—carvacrol, 54.1%, terpinolene, 20.6% and α-phellandrene, 5.3%) had a positive effect on the preservation of kiwi fruits in the post-harvest stage, by reducing fungal rot [ 32]. Belgian commercial SHEO exerted antimicrobial properties against bacteria commonly found on fishes— L. innocua, P. fluorescens and A. hydrophila/caviae (in disc diffusion experiments) and against L. innocua and A. hydrophila/caviae (in volatile diffusion experiments) [ 33].
